content: Linjin Pavilion is a security attraction built by the South Korean government to pray for the reunification of the Korean Peninsula and comfort those Koreans who separated their loved ones in the Korean War. It is only a few kilometers away from the Korean-Korean military demarcation line. There is a must-visit attraction in Linjin Pavilion called "Freedom". The bridge is where the Chinese and North Korean forces and the United Nations exchange prisoners after the Korean War. The more than 10,000 Korean soldiers who were captured were returned to South Korea after passing through the bridge.
The bridge has a very important position in Korean history, with many reminiscent articles and monuments next to it, for several years of Korean independence.

The Bridge of Freedom (FreedomBridge) is located behind the Wangbai Temple in front of Linjin Pavilion Square. It is a bridge laid after the signing of the Korean War Armistice Agreement in 1953. It is 83 meters long. This is where the two sides exchanged prisoners of war. More than 12,000 prisoners of war returned to South Korea from the bridge, shouting "Long live freedom" as they passed it, and the bridge was named after it
The lions were leaning on both ends of the bridge, and were very powerful, with the famous vegetable market at one end of the bridge.
Very good place, it feels very good, very artistic, especially beautiful.

The bridge of freedom is a very large span bridge, the structure of this bridge is very good, it is all clay, there are many connecting buffers, the left side of the bridge is a hillside, the right is a small town.
This green steel bridge, with a little old feeling, feels special literature. In fact, Budapest at night is the moment to truly show its charm, Budapest, belongs to the night.

The bridge has its specific cultural value and historical significance, so it is worth visiting and understanding Korean history.

Take bus 10 from Incheon Metro Station and you can reach the main entrance in about 5 minutes. The theme inside is the roots and living conditions and development of Koreans moving overseas, but unfortunately only a small part of them have English information, and most of them can't understand it in Korean.
If you come to Incheon, you must go to places. There are no admission fees, the staff are very friendly, and there are so many things to see. It will help you study history.
Travel from the Skytrain station Incheon Purple Line, sit to the end of the line The Museum is about 5 minutes from the station, mainly in Korean, not very accessible. But it is worth studying
A small museum, but the history of immigration in South Korea is also a bit interesting.

It is said that after the Korean Kingdom opened its flashy modernization campaign from Incheon, it once pursued a pro-American policy, and it coincided with the lack of labor on the Hawaii plantation in the United States. So the two sides met together, led by the American Church, and the North Korean government cooperated vigorously. Thousands of North Koreans boarded the Shanghai cruise at Incheon Port, crossed the Pacific Ocean and made their way to Hawaii, then spread from Hawaii to the entire Americas. It can be seen that the display has made a lot of effort in research, and the introduction is very detailed. The main thrust is two: pro-US and anti-Japanese, but it is closely coordinated with South Korea's diplomatic policy.

South Korea MacArthur Park is a relatively decaying place, there is nothing to play, like climbing is a good journey, by the way, there is China Street, all Chinese shops, but Incheon cosmetics are much cheaper.

The Korean Immigration Museum records about 100 years of immigration history since the official beginning of immigration in 1902. It can be visited for free and contains information about early immigrants such as passports issued more than 100 years ago. It has historical characteristics and is worth seeing.
No tickets, the voice guide machine inside is free, as long as you mortgage the documents, the service is great, you can see, talk about the history of Korean immigrants.

South Korea also has a certain immigration base Incheon, as a modern coastal port city facing the Shandong Peninsula and Liaodong, has a lot of foreign people introduced. Now it has built a new digital city for the future on Songdao. It will undoubtedly bring more human capital to the development of this city. Source
